channel.title: MobiledgeX
channel.description: MobiledgeX is a creating a marketplace of edge resources and services that will connect developers with the world’s largest mobile networks to power the next generation of applications and devices.

item.title: [Event] Join MobiledgeX and partners for a discussion of infrastructure critical to mobile AR/VR at AWE USA 2021 (Nov 11th 9:30 a.m.- 10:25 a.m PT)
item.description: Join Vasanth Mohan, Developer Advocate at MobiledgeX, and XR/AR ecosystem innovators for “5G EDGE COMPUTE : ESSENTIAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO SCALE AR & VR”, an AWE USA 2021 hosted panel discussion on Nov 11th 9:30am-10:25am PT.

item.title: 1000 Realities
item.description: 1000 Realities is a Polish software studio that specializes in Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) applications.

item.title: 2019 Datacloud Global Congress
item.description: The premier leadership summit for critical IT infrastructure.

item.title: 2019 Digital X
item.description: DIGITAL X IS EUROPE'S LEADING DIGITALISATION INITIATIVE FOR DECISION-MAKERS

item.title: 2019 Edge Computing Congress
item.description: Edge Computing Congress is the only event to not only bring together the full edge ecosystem, but to define it and assist you in understanding the drivers and potential for edge computing in your business

item.title: 2019 MobiledgeX Developer Engagement Recap
item.description: Once again we are at the end of the year and quite a year it has been for MobiledgeX.

item.title: 2019 MWC Americas
item.description: MWC Los Angeles 2019 is one of the newest and fastest growing events in the U.S. that brings together leading companies and influential experts from all sectors within the mobile technology industry to advance Intelligent Connectivity

item.title: 2019 ONF Connect
item.description: ONF Connect is recognized as the leading event for next-generation SDN and open source networking.

item.title: 2019 ONS Europe
item.description: Open Networking Summit is the industry’s premier open networking event, enabling collaborative development and innovation across enterprises, service providers and cloud providers and discussing the future of Open Source Networking, including SDN, NFV, VNF, CNF/Cloud Native Networking, Orchestration, Automation of Cloud, Core Network, Edge, Access & IoT services.

item.title: 2019 SKT 5G MEC Hackathon
item.description: Developers and Startups interested in upgrading 5G and low-latency data-based services and usability

item.title: 2019 Vodafone Arch Summit
item.description: Arch Summit 2019 Luxembourg brings together executives from Vodafone's global network, cutting edge startups and leading innovators to one place.

item.title: 2020 NetDev 0x14
item.description: Netdev 0x14 coming to Vancouver, Canada this spring, March 17th to 20th, 2020.

item.title: 5G Edge Challenge Event Recap
item.description: Alex Donn recaps the Rogers 5G Edge Challenge in Vancouver.

item.title: 5G Live #1: The Edge Developer Opportunity
item.description: In this webinar, MobiledgeX will discuss the Seamster.io, community-based initiative focused on finding the most interesting use cases that will happen the fastest and what is needed from telecom to enable them.

item.title: 5G QoS API for Edge Native Developers
5G Unpacked
item.description: Telco and Cloud are intrinsically different because of the much broader use of standards in Telco, and how those standards then dictate a long, complex and expensive generational system, with the unfortunate need to sell the future that no one really understands until it emerges.

item.title: A Technical Overview of the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0 Platform
item.description: A technical overview of the most important new features of the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0 platfiorm update.

item.title: About
item.description: MobiledgeX is a trusted edge computing company founded by Deutsche Telekom AG that offers global orchestration, automation, and monitoring for any workload across different infrastructure and any cloud, public or private. The company is headquartered in San Jose, California.

item.title: Accedian and MobiledgeX Partner to Bring an Open Ecosystem for Flawless Delivery of Low Latency 5G Digital Experiences
item.description: Performance management and security threat detection visibility from Accedian to augment MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud with critical customer experience and revenue stream assurance capabilities.

item.title: Accedian, Solace, and MobiledgeX Partner to Deliver Assured Performance for Next-Generation 5G and IoT Services
item.description: Accedian, Solace, and MobiledgeX today announced a partnership that enables leading organizations to make edge computing a key pillar in their digital transformation strategy. The partnership meets the acute market need for the event-driven edge infrastructure required for mission-critical applications that is also focused on business outcomes.

item.title: Advancing Developer Engagement
item.description: Launching our first Early Access program and the public launch of our Edge Navigator use case research tool.

item.title: Aicuda Technology
item.description: Aicuda Technology is passionately dedicated to bringing groundbreaking technology solutions to the security, safety, health and operations markets.

item.title: Akraino 5G MEC Hackathon
item.description: LF Edge and Akraino are teaming up with ETSI MEC (Muli-access Edge Computing) for a combined hackathon focused on 5G

item.title: Analysys Mason Perspective: Need for Operator Edge Native Cloud
item.description: Analysys Mason explores need for operator implementation of edge-native clouds

item.title: Architecture
item.description: Our SDK, API and Distributed Matching Engine (DME) dynamically places application backends as close to requesting mobile applications as possible.

item.title: AvidThink Research Brief: Orchestrator of Orchestrators — Unifying the Edge
item.description: MobiledgeX is proud to supply mobile network operators with the latest insights from thought leaders like AvidThink. We invite you to read their research brief “Orchestrator of Orchestrators — Unifying the Edge”

item.title: Blog
item.description: Perspectives on the power of the edge & why it is changing how we live

item.title: BootstrapLabs: Applied Artificial Intelligence Conference
item.description: A forum to learn, network, and discover the latest insights on Applied AI

item.title: Careers
item.description: We’re a passionate team dedicated to delivering on planet sized opportunities, finally [solving application mobility in entirety](/technology) and enabling networks to deliver more than just connectivity. We’re bringing edge services to the applications and devices powering the next generation of experiences.

item.title: Case Study: Deutsche Telekom Remote Augmented Reality Rendering using MobiledgeX and NVIDIA CloudXR
item.description: Deutsche Telekom, NVIDIA, and MobiledgeX have collaborated to highlight the advantages of running CloudXR at on the Telco Edge

item.title: Cloudlet Infrastructure Explained
item.description: Knowing a little about modern infrastructure makes it a lot easier to understand where MobiledgeX fits in and creates value. Let's talk through the components

item.title: Cloudlets
item.description: Cloudlets are modern, virtualized (container) infrastructure that provides standardization, resource allocation and security to operators and developers.

item.title: Computer Vision Persistent TCP Connection
item.description: We recently upgraded our Android MobiledgeX SDK Demo from using REST API Calls to a Persistent TCP implementation. Let's learn about the benefits of using Persistent TCP for your implementation.

item.title: Computer Vision WebSocket Support
item.description: We recently upgraded our Android MobiledgeX SDK Demo from using Persistent TCP to a Websocket implementation. Let's learn about the benefits of using Websocket for your implementation.

item.title: Connect (X)
item.description: Connect (X) is the only business technology event in North America designed for all stakeholders delivering infrastructure solutions and for ubiquitous connectivity.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact the MobiledgeX Team

item.title: Converting P2P Application to Client-Server
item.description: Peer to Peer apps are built to optimize for local low latency situations. Edge Computing offers the same benefit and more, but using client-server architecture. Learn more about why it's worth converting to client-server.

item.title: Deutsche Telekom Completes World’s First Public Mobile Edge Network, Powered By MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud R1.0
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud R1.0 gives developers worldwide immediate access to deploy application backend close to mobile users inside Telekom Deutschland network in Germany for live trials around Augmented Reality (AR), Mixed Reality (MR), and Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) use cases in the same way they deploy workloads in the public cloud.

item.title: Deutsche Telekom, Niantic And Mobiledgex Partner To Create Advanced Augmented Reality Experiences Over New Mobile Network Technologies
item.description: Niantic to Bring Proprietary Real World Platform for Augmented Reality Gaming to Deutsche Telekom’s MobiledgeX Edge Servers And 5G Network to Create Scalable End-User Experiences

item.title: Deutsche Telekom, Niantic Inc., MobiledgeX and Samsung Showcase World’s First Mobile Edge Mixed Reality Multi-Gamer Experience
item.description: Niantic’s “Codename: Neon”, the world’s first edge-enhanced Mixed Reality Multiplayer Experience, delivered by ultra-low latency, Deutsche Telekom edge-enabled network, and Samsung Galaxy S10+ with edge computing enablement, will be playable by the public for the first time.

item.title: Developer Insights: How App Developers are using MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud
item.description: We've worked with dozens of app developers over the last few years, and that experience has given us valuable insight into how developers are using our MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform.

item.title: Developer Spotlight: forwARdgame
item.description: MobiledgeX Developer Advocate Vasanth Mohan sits down with Tim Friedland, the CEO of forwARdgame, to find out how they are using 5G and the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform for multiplayer AR application development around the world.

item.title: Developer Spotlight: Krasi Nikolov from QuarkXR
item.description: MobiledgeX Developer Advocate Vasanth Mohan sits down with Krasi Nikolov, the CEO of QuarkXR, to find out how QuarkXR is using 5G and the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform for CloudXR application development.

item.title: Developer Spotlight: Offloading Computer Vision Workloads to the Telco Edge for Unity Applications
item.description: Ahmed Hassan at MobiledgeX has been working on an open source Computer Vision solution for Unity that connects to an OpenCV server deployed on the MobiledgeX Edge Computing platform.

item.title: Developer Spotlight: Unmanned Life
item.description: MobiledgeX Developer Advocate Vasanth Mohan sits down with Kim Clement, the CTO of Unmanned Life, to find out how they are using 5G and the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform for autonomous vehicles and drones to save lives!

item.title: Digitizing the Real World @ CloudXR Hackathon Hubraum
item.description: Boy did the developers deliver on new ideas for our recent CloudXR Hackathon hosted by Hubraum in Berlin on October 19th.

item.title: Dimenco
item.description: Dimenco is a Dutch company that is redefining the future of human-computer interaction by launching “Simulated Reality” 3D without wearables.

item.title: Discovering Edge Use Cases
item.description: Learn how MobiledgeX is discovering and understanding edge use cases

item.title: DT and Rubean successfully demonstrate time and security-critical payment mobile "Point of Sale" application (PhonePOS)with edge computing
item.description: Edge Computing tested by Deutsche Telekom (DT) and Rubean promises to deliver a new seamless user experience for time-and security-critical payment applications such as the Cloud Point-of-Sale PhonePOS from Rubean. The collaborative partners showed how edge computing enables interactive cloud-based payment transactions and protects the payment processed in the edge cloud on Deutsche Telekom’s network in Germany using MobiledgeX’s Edge Cloud PaaS.

item.title: Dutch Guild Multi-Media Meeting: 5G and Media
item.description: Experts explain what 5G will mean for media, both in production and in distribution.

item.title: Edge Application Developer Hackathon
item.description: TIP Community Lab welcomes developers to hack on edge infrastructure.

item.title: Edge as an Opportunity
item.description: At Mobile World Congress America, Jason Hoffman presented a high-level explanation of what MobiledgeX is building, and why.

item.title: Edge computing from the front line: developer case studies
item.description: In this webinar we will present case studies “from the front lines” of developers and enterprises testing edge computing today across different applications such as AR/VR, video analytics, drone/UAV, live experiences and retail.

item.title: Edge Computing World
item.description: THE ONLY EVENT THAT BRINGS TOGETHER THE ENTIRE EDGE ECOSYSTEM

item.title: Edge Experience Hackathon
item.description: Join MobiledgeX and partners for a 24-hour hackathon in Kraków, Poland! The challenge for the weekend is to create new immersive experiences using the MobiledgeX platform.

item.title: Edge Featured in Newest Heavy Reading “5G Network & Service Strategies Operator Survey”
item.description: Eric Braun shares insights on the latest findings from the recent Heavy Reading whitepaper, and the value edge can bring to 5G.

item.title: Edge Global Congress 2019
item.description: Learn how computing data at the Edge will connect everything.

item.title: Edge Lab
item.description: MobiledgeX and WWT invite ISVs to explore their Converged Edge Platform Lab

item.title: Edge Services
item.description: The MobiledgeX platform for operators exposes Edge Services APIs that are required by developers building Edge Native Solutions.

item.title: Edge-Enabled Autonomous Search and Rescue Using Drones
EdgeMesh
item.description: EdgeMesh enhances your visitors browser with client side intelligent caching, adaptive security and dynamic routing capabilities.

item.title: Events
item.description: Connect with MobiledgeX at these upcoming events, conferences and meetups.

item.title: Everyone Gets Paid
item.description: The future looks very different. It always does. The future requires different solutions. It always does. It is hard to see what these new solutions will look like before they arrive, this is the challenge MobiledgeX has undertaken, to transform how we enable software developers and new device makers to build the experiences of the future.

item.title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About 5G
Exploring the Edge — Observations from our Hackathon with SKT
item.description: Wonho Park recaps our experience at the SKT 5G Hackathon.

item.title: Finding the Edge at Scale
item.description: After presenting at Edge Computing Congress in Berlin, Sunay Tripathi shares insights on the high value in being able to execute various services near the edge of the mobile network.

item.title: forwARdgame
item.description: forwARdgame is a Berlin, Germany based startup focused on Augmented Reality and massive scale multiplayer gaming

item.title: From the Cloud to the Edge
item.description: The MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform helps telco operators build their own edge clouds and generate new revenue while giving developers a platform to run their apps on telco edge infrastructure.

item.title: Get in the know about Edge
item.description: Gain access to MobiledgeX market research, edge resources and insight.

item.title: Get the Power of the Edge with a Single Line of Code
item.description: edgemesh is an American startup founded by Jacob Loveless. Six months after opening for general availability, edgemesh operates on more than 3,500 networks globally, providing their dynamic web acceleration platform to websites where milliseconds matter.

item.title: Google
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform integration with Google Anthos brings the power and resources of the public cloud to mobile network operators and the enterprise for maximum infrastructure choice and workload control.

item.title: GPU Benchmarking on the Edge with Computer Vision Object Detection
item.description: With the growing popularity of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning applications, GPU availability has become more critical than ever.

item.title: Hacking with Open Source and TIP
item.description: Alex Donn shares details on what to expect at the Edge Application Developer Hackathon on April 30.

item.title: HardwareCon
item.description: Learn about the latest technology and business trends in AI, Machine Learning, Robotics, IoT, Blockchain, Product Design and more.

item.title: Holo-Light
item.description: Holo-Light specializes in immersive software and technologies for the enterprise market. The company has developed a unique remote rendering SDK (ISAR) that allows users to stream entire big data XR applications in real-time. Leveraging MobiledgeX’s edge service the technology enables a new way of experiencing and interacting with 3D content.

item.title: Home
item.description: Learn how our latest release implements standards based edge cloud federation interfaces, 5G QoS API and support for “bare metal” Google Anthos deployments.

item.title: How Latency Reduction Can Improve the User Experience for Mobile Applications
item.description: The MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform helps bring application data closer to mobile device users.

item.title: How Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) Can Extend Their Role as a Utility Provider
item.description: The MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform creates opportunities for MNOs to build strong relationships with their customers.

item.title: How MobiledgeX Helped Slavic Monsters During the First GSMA TEC Trial
item.description: The race to provide the future of edge computing is being led by an inspired initiative called the GSMA Telco Edge Cloud (TEC). TEC creates and launches global edge computing services that are being proven to provide businesses, developers, and gamers with an open, global, and federated solution from Telco networks.

item.title: How MobiledgeX Helps Leading Telecom Operators Embrace a Cloud-Native Edge Network Strategy
item.description: We're excited to share some of our successful work from the GSMA TEC and OPG services trials, where we worked closely with leading telecom operators such as Deutsche Telekom, Telefonica, and British Telecom to prove our technology.

item.title: How MobiledgeX Helps Operators (and Developers) Get the Most Out of the Telco Network Edge
item.description: Using the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform, telco operators can utilize their own telco network edge infrastructure to create — and monetize — their own edge clouds.

item.title: How MobiledgeX Helps Telecom Operators Manage Private and Trusted Cloudlets for their Enterprise Customers
item.description: Learn how the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform provides a flexible architecture that offers telecom operators the opportunity to transform their edge cloudlets into private edge cloudlets.

item.title: How MobiledgeX is Building a Marketplace for Edge
item.description: MobiledgeX is putting forward a single interface that creates a marketplace shared between Telcos and developers to deliver value propositions, where both types of consumers can take advantage of a number of benefits offered by the Platform.

item.title: How MobiledgeX is working with NVIDIA to Bring Metropolis to the Telco Edge
item.description: Working jointly with our developer partners, we've deployed applications that demonstrate the advantages of combining NVIDIA technologies leveraging GPUs with telco edge cloud infrastructure to help solve edge computing challenges.

item.title: How Our Mobile Operator Partners Benefit
item.description: This new developer-friendly and cloud-agile partnership enables mobile operators to participate in rapidly emerging and evolving opportunities since they can now augment and evolve their own infrastructure and local offerings at cloud-speed.

item.title: How to Add Multiplayer to a Unity Project using MobiledgeX Edge Multiplay
item.description: To support developers with use cases in multiplayer gaming, MobiledgeX has open sourced a multiplayer message relay game server called Edge Multiplay.

item.title: Hubraum CloudXR Hackathon
item.description: hubraum presents: a 48-hour-hackathon to build cloud-based XR applications!

item.title: IIT RTC Conference and Expo
item.description: Hosted by Illinois Institute of Technology's Real-Time Communications Lab, this annual Conference and Expo focuses on where industry and academia connect.

item.title: Immersiv.io
item.description: Immersiv.io is a French company delivering the latest and greatest in immersive sports experiences.

item.title: Intel
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform integrates Intel’s latest 3rd Gen Intel Xeon Scalable processors to bring built-in AI, crypto acceleration and advanced security capabilities for mobile edge infrastructure, services and applications.

item.title: Interactor
item.description: Interactor is a technology company headquartered in Silicon Valley creating new ways to build smart solutions using any device and service. Their product API AutoFlow is an UI-based action flow mechanism that enables complex backend solutions for both edge and cloud computing.

item.title: Introducing MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 2.0
item.description: We've released MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 2.0, which extends the capabilities into the private edge with on-premise deployments now as easy to manage as public edge.

item.title: Join the MobiledgeX Developer Community on Discord
item.description: We're happy to announce our new MobiledgeX developer community on Discord, which will help us work even more closely with developers making the next generation of applications for the telco edge.

item.title: KDDI, Deutsche Telekom, MobiledgeX, Sturfee and Mawari to Demonstrate Bloom City Next-Generation AR Mobile App Experience in Alignment with GSMA Foundry Telco Edge Cloud (TEC) Trials Initiative
item.description: Jointly-developed proof of concept will feature hyper-realistic virtual human from KDDI’s au VISION STUDIO, demonstrating development and testing of XR enablers and applications harmonized across multiple mobile network operator (MNO) edge networks and infrastructures.

item.title: KDDI, Deutsche Telekom, MobiledgeX, Sturfee, and Mawari Announce the First Global PaaS Collaboration to Accelerate XR Application Development on an Edge Computing Platform
item.description: Creation of business opportunities through global distribution of content from KDDI’s au VISION STUDIO

item.title: Leadership
item.description: The MobiledgeX leadership team has unparalleled experience in business, science and technology.

item.title: Making Edge a Reality
item.description: For the first time, 3rd parties are deploying directly to private mobile operator edge infrastructure without any human involvement, dynamically allocating their workloads as close to their mobile users as possible.

item.title: Managing Edge Applications using the MobiledgeX Auto Provisioning Policy Engine
item.description: In this blog post we’ll discuss the policies that MobiledgeX provides for automatically deploying applications for two use cases: on-demand deployment, and high-availability deployment.

item.title: Massive Technologies Showcases the Advantage of Unity Render Streaming at hubraum
item.description: As part of hubraum's iOS AR Innovation Program, MobiledgeX worked with startups like Massive Technologies to help take advantage of edge computing.

item.title: Mawari
item.description: Mawari, Inc. is a pioneer in cloud rendering and streaming technology for interactive AR experiences.

item.title: MNO Success Stories
item.description: MobiledgeX works with MNOs, Edge Native SW developers and standards bodies to drive the success of MNOs in the Telco Edge Cloud market. Here are some of our TEC success stories:

item.title: Mobile operator Edge is critical to Facebook’s “Meta”
item.description: Mobile network operator supplied edge cloud is critical to the realization of Facebook "Meta"

item.title: MobiledgeX & Sfara form a Global Technology Partnership
item.description: Addressing Driver Analytics and Mobile Assurance Services for the Reinsurance & Insurance industry arising from the introduction and ongoing development of semi-autonomous and fully-autonomous Level 3 through Level 5 automotive, trucking, transportation, mobility, fleet management and ride sharing services.

item.title: MobiledgeX and Deutsche Telekom Show Edge Live in Germany
item.description: At Edge Computing Congress, Berlin, MobiledgeX, publicly demonstrated its ability to bring the Cloud closer to users by placing 3rd party workloads into live telecom edge based on end user location

item.title: MobiledgeX and Google Anthos Integration Now Live at the WWT Advanced Technology Center
item.description: MobiledgeX on Anthos delivers maximum infrastructure choice and workload control for the mobile network operator and enterprise customer.

item.title: MobiledgeX and Intel Partner to Optimize AI, Security and Portability for Multi-cloud Deployments
item.description: MobiledgeX and Intel have partnered to integrate Intel’s 3rd Gen Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors for built-in AI, crypto acceleration and advanced security capabilities for mobile edge infrastructure, services and applications.

item.title: MobiledgeX and Mavenir Enable Global Edge Connectivity with Deutsche Telekom
item.description: Cloud-native dynamic deployment of 5G Core driven by emerging application needs including 4G/5G Private Networks

item.title: MobiledgeX and QiO Technologies Interoperability Underpins 5G-Enabled Digital Transformation Solutions
item.description: QiO’s industrial Analytical Applications can now be seamlessly orchestrated to the edge, private and public cloud.

item.title: MobiledgeX and Savari Partner to Bring C-V2X to the Mobile Edge
item.description: MobiledgeX, Inc., which is making edge computing widely accessible and easy to consume, and Savari, Inc., a Silicon Valley-based auto tech company and a pioneer of Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) communications technology for smart infrastructure, today announced a strategic partnership to jointly enable enhanced Cellular Vehicle-to-Everything (C-V2X) use cases for automotive OEMs, their fleet management, and mobility-as-a-service partners.

item.title: MobiledgeX and SK Telecom to Demonstrate the Next Generation of Connected Devices and Edge-Enabled Application Experiences at MWC
item.description: MobiledgeX and SK Telecom have moved from partnership announcement at the end of 2018 to demonstrating live edge-enabled applications, devices, and experiences in the SK Telecom booth at Mobile World Congress 2019.

item.title: MobiledgeX and TELUS to trial mobile edge network in Canada
item.description: MobiledgeX, which helps make edge computing widely accessible and easy to consume, today announced it will work with TELUS, one of Canada’s largest telecommunications companies, to trial its edge network in Canada. Third parties, such as mobile application developers, consumer device makers, and IoT hardware manufacturers will be enabled by end-to-end low latency and a global network of participating MobiledgeX operators to innovate with these new edge performance capabilities.

item.title: MobiledgeX and VMware Collaborate on Edge to Power the Next Wave of Telco Transformation
item.description: With the launch of MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud R2.0 and its adoption within GSMA’s recently announced Telco Edge Cloud initiative, it is now possible to seamlessly lifecycle manage application and solution software across both enterprise on-premises edge infrastructure and telecom operator public edge to maximize performance and availability, and minimize cost.

item.title: MobiledgeX and World Wide Technology Expand Partnership to Accelerate Mobile Edge Computing Deployments and Power 5G Profitability
item.description: Sunay Tripathi shares an update on our partnership with WWT

item.title: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0: Continuous Integration and Development using MobiledgeX EdgeBox
item.description: With the release of MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0, developers on the platform can begin quick iterative testing and deployments of their applications using MobilegeX EdgeBox.

item.title: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0: Enhanced GPU/vGPU Support
item.description: The latest release of the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform includes enhanced support for GPUs and vGPUs. With GPUs at the edge, an application developer has the benefit of deploying an application backend that has lower processing time with lower network latency.

item.title: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0: Improved Visibility and Operational Management of Cloudlets for Operators
item.description: With MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0 operators can now start leveraging our controller as the resource manager rather than relying only on their IaaS layer to determine the resource availability of cloudlets.

item.title: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0: Optimal Edge Connectivity with EdgeEvents
item.description: Learn how MobiledgeX EdgeEvents — introduced in MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0 — improves edge connectivity for developers.

item.title: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud with Google Cloud’s Anthos: A Powerful Platform for 5G, CDN, and Privacy-Centric AI Applications
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud on Anthos gives telecom operators the freedom and flexibility to orchestrate and automate select 5G applications that demand a higher level of security and privacy.

item.title: MobiledgeX Extends Edge Computing Support To The Enterprise With Platform Update
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 2.0 seamlessly integrates private and public edges, allowing developers to deploy location-specific services globally

item.title: MobiledgeX Helps Startups Utilize the Telco Edge Cloud
item.description: In order to make edge computing practical, MobiledgeX partnered with each of the startups in the 5G Consumer Entertainment Program in order to provide early access to our platform and enable each startup to deploy their backend services on our telco edge cloud.

item.title: MobiledgeX Introduces Federation With Any Edge Platform To Streamline Mobile Network Deployments For Developers
item.description: MobiledgeX today announced version 3.1 of its MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform, introducing federation between any standards-based mobile edge computing platform, 5G QoS services and support for “bare metal” Kubernetes deployments including Google Anthos

item.title: MobiledgeX Joins the Telecom Infra Project’s Edge Application Developer Project Group
item.description: MobiledgeX, Deutsche Telekom and Intel Taking Leading Roles in Launch of New TIP Project Group Focused on Enabling Developers to Build the Next Generation of Mobile Applications on Operators’ Edge Infrastructure

item.title: MobiledgeX Kicks Off “Edge Experience” Developer Discovery
item.description: Powers first edge computing hackathon ahead of upcoming early access program that will make its code available to application developers for early edge experimentation in real networks.

item.title: MobiledgeX Launches Beta Program for Orchestrating Edge Computing Workloads on Google Cloud’s Anthos
item.description: Beta program to demonstrate how integrating the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform with Anthos allows telco operators to deploy privacy-centric applications while maintaining data sovereignty and control.

item.title: MobiledgeX Platform Update Brings Choice And Control To Mobile Network Operators Deploying To Public Clouds
item.description: MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud 3.0 provides a common interface to manage public and private edge cloud rollouts, laying the groundwork for telecom operators to diversify hyperscaler engagement.

item.title: MobiledgeX Rapidly Expands Global Mobile Edge Adoption and Ecosystem
item.description: MobiledgeX, Inc., which is making edge computing widely accessible and easy to access, today reported that it now counts 30 category-defining developer applications and 13 top-tier mobile operators as part of its fast-growing global edge network initiative.

item.title: MobiledgeX Releases World’s First Public Mobile Edge
item.description: We’ve announced the first public mobile edge running in the Deutsche Telekom cellular infrastructure in Germany. Let’s unpack that.

item.title: MobiledgeX selected to the 'GSMA' 100
item.description: MobiledgeX Taking Leading Role in GSMA Initiative to Advance Next Generation of Connectivity and Digital Services

item.title: MobiledgeX Shares Wealth Of Edge Computing Research Data To Jumpstart Industry-Wide Collaboration As It Kicks Off Early Access Developer Program
item.description: Released more than three years of proprietary edge use case research and launches its interactive Edge Navigator tool to kick off industry-wide edge knowledge sharing and collaboration.

item.title: MobiledgeX Simplifies 5G Edge for Google Cloud Developers
item.description: Google Cloud developers will have new access to 5G telco edge cloud services such as latency reduction and device-based location to drive the next generation of edge computing applications.

item.title: MobiledgeX Unity SDK 2.1.2 with Magic Leap One
item.description: Learn how to use the new MobiledgeX Unity SDK to harness the telco edge cloud to enhance face detection performance with Magic Leap One AR glasses.

item.title: MondoDX
item.description: MondoDX is a Corporate Venture and Innovation Lab that specializes in creating digital products using AR+VR+AI, with taylored solutions for custom demands and proprietary products to solve market challenges and accelerate digital transformation.

item.title: Multi-Container Applications
item.description: Learn how the Android MobiledgeX SDK Demo is architected using multi-containers that are hosted both on the MobiledgeX Edge infrastructure and public cloud.

item.title: Netdev 0X13
item.description: The Technical Conference on Linux Networking

item.title: New TIP Edge Application Developer Project Group
item.description: At the TIP Summit, a new working group called “The Edge Application Developer Project Group” was announced. Many questions have come up, so we thought we’d explain why it was created.

item.title: Newsroom
item.description: We believe the edge is a missing piece in a value chain that connects mobile operators, application developers, cloud providers, and device makers such that everyone wins.

item.title: NFV
item.description: We designed MobiledgeX Cloudlets to work with mobile operators’ Network Functions Virtualization infrastructure from the start.

item.title: Niantic
item.description: Niantic has leveraged ultra low latency Edge enabled networks to dynamically resolve scale and user assurance

item.title: NTT DOCOMO and MobiledgeX Demonstrate Worldwide Distribution of 5G Applications in Japan
item.description: Quick, easy distribution of 5G solutions will help partners expand globally

item.title: NVIDIA
item.description: NVIDIA and MobiledgeX are working together to give application developers the tools they need to run their applications with enhanced performance at the telco edge while leveraging NVIDIA GPUs and vGPU technology for scalability.

item.title: Nvidia GTC 2021 Recap : How Operators can work with AI Use Cases using MobiledgeX and Nvidia
item.description: Nvidia GTC was chock full of many amazing announcements this year, with one of the core focuses being on AI use cases leveraging 5G and edge computing.

item.title: One-Touch Provisioning for Automatic Cloudlet Onboarding
item.description: The MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform provides a faster point of entry for customers to access their edge network and deploy applications closest to their users.

item.title: OnEdge #1: How Will Edge Work?
item.description: Sunay Tripathi, CTO & EVP Engineering at MobiledgeX, kicks off the podcast with a description of how Edge completes the mobility journey.

item.title: OnEdge #2: Building an Edge Marketplace
item.description: Eric Braun, Chief Commercial Officer at MobiledgeX, shares insights on building an edge marketplace and how all the key players must come together.

item.title: OnEdge #3: Aligning the Industry for Edge
item.description: As VP Operator Ecosystem and Support for MobiledgeX, Tomasz Gerszberg discusses how to bring together an ecosystem of operators, cloud providers, and developers for edge computing.

item.title: OnEdge #4: Enabling Edge at the Speed of Technology
item.description: Geoff Hollingworth, Chief Marketing Officer at MobiledgeX, shares why the timing is right for edge and the business opportunities for mobile operators and developers.

item.title: ONS: North America
item.description: Open Networking Summit is the industry’s premier open networking event, enabling collaborative development and innovation across enterprises, service providers and cloud providers and discussing the future of Open Source Networking, including SDN, NFV, VNF, CNF/Cloud Native Networking, Orchestration, Automation of Cloud, Core Network, Edge, Access & IoT services.

item.title: Panel: Will the COVID-19 pandemic precipitate a rapid expansion of edge?
item.description: MobiledgeX CEO, Jason Hoffman, joins an all-star industry panel to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on the expansion of edge computing.

item.title: Partners
item.description: MobiledgeX works with some of the world’s leading technology companies to help give mobile network operators (MNOs) more choice and control over how they utilize their own telco network edge infrastructure.

item.description: MobiledgeX, Inc., ("Company", “Us”, “Our” or "We") respects your privacy and is committed to protecting it through our compliance with this policy.

item.description: This blog posts explains what we are doing with SKT this week, why we are doing it and at the end how other operators interested can do similar in their markets around the world.

item.title: Solace and MobiledgeX Partner to Help Automakers Transform the Future of Mobility
item.description: Solace, the leading enabler of real-time event-driven data streaming for enterprise computing, IoT and mobile applications, and MobiledgeX, which is making edge computing widely accessible and easy to consume, today announced a partnership designed to help automakers offer hyper-personalized mobility services that enhance safety and convenience for drivers.

item.description: VREE develops platforms that enable multiple-users to have a synchronized full-body experience in VR. Read how VREE's platform takes advantage of 5G and edge compute to deliver a solid real time experience within these virtual environments.

item.description: With the MobiledgeX EdgeBox demo program, operators can test drive our MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform using a Mac, Windows, or Linux PC with Python 3 and internet access.

item.title: The Telco Edge Cloud Explained
item.description: What is the telco edge cloud, and how does it differ from both cloud computing and edge computing? We’ll explain the differences and explain why the telco edge cloud is so important for the next generation of 5G mobile applications.

item.title: The Year of the Mobile Edge
item.description: As we launch into the new year, Sunay Tripathi takes a look at the evolving mobile, internet and cloud ecosystems to explain why 2020 will be the year of the mobile edge and why now is the time to take action for anyone who wants to be a player in the emerging mobile edge market.

item.title: TIP Community Lab Launches Cloudlet for Edge Application Developers

item.title: Use Cases—The Strange Dance of Invention, Innovation and Discovery
item.description: Every successful innovator discovers, sooner or later, the important role that customers play in the process of innovation. I’m not talking about innovation being market driven—most interesting innovation begins with some form of technical invention.

item.title: Using Redis Face Training Data
item.description: What we want to accomplish is to use Redis to store the face training images that get uploaded to the centralized Face Training Server, and make them available to the Face Recognition process on each instance of a Computer Vision Server.

item.title: VMware
item.description: Mobile network operators, MNOs, are embracing digital transformation. They’re looking to a cloud-native approach to 5G to help them compete and thrive in the digital era. That’s where the 5G-ready VMware Telco Cloud Platform together with the MobiledgeX Edge-Cloud platform can help MNOs.

item.description: The VR Ecosystems & Standards Workshop will focus on next-generation immersive formats and services, and it will investigate 5G business opportunities brought by immersive services – as well as their requirements.

item.description: Join us as we discuss the current state of the edge, enabling the future state of hybrid networks, and the industry need for edge-enabled capabilities.

item.title: Why Deutsche Telekom Created MobiledgeX
item.description: It may seem strange or even counter-intuitive that Deutsche Telekom (DT), a mobile operator with a specific cellular telephony franchise in competitive markets, would create MobiledgeX, a new venture chartered to serve any or all mobile operators (not just DT). Here’s the backstory that explains why.

item.title: World Wide Technology and MobiledgeX Expand Partnership to Accelerate Mobile Edge Computing Deployments and Power 5G Profitability

item.title: World Wide Technology and MobiledgeX partner to validate Mobile Edge Computing solution readiness for global operator edge deployments
WWT
item.description: World Wide Technology (WWT), a global technology solutions provider that combines strategy and execution to deliver transformational outcomes, and MobiledgeX help organizations accelerate global edge computing deployments at scale by delivering edge cloud solutions to more quickly drive ROI of infrastructure investments.
